title: addurls --no-save (or `--run` at the top level of the API)
body:
#### What is the problem?
It might be something we would like to do at the higher level than just this single command though but the use case came here: I would like to `datalad run` the `datalad addurls`, i.e. to record the provenance on the parameters etc of the command since its specification could be quite elaborate!  The only way I see it could be done now if `addurls` does everything but the last commit, and then actual commit is done by the `run`.

I would see similar need for any command which might be coming with non-trivial specification and which might be causing the `--save` in the current branch (or `git-annex`!  we can pass commit msg to be used by annex btw):  `create-sibling`, probably some of the current plugins?
May be it is worth adding `--run` at the top datalad interface level which would trigger pre-generation of the commit message with information about which command was invoked so it would be used during `save` operation.  Tricky points:
-- there might be multiple `save`'s for a single `datalad` command.

We might see interaction with `crawl` to some degree. now a dedicated `crawl-init` is used (with the "plugin" way to specify options) which stores crawler parameters under `.datalad/crawl/crawl.cfg` but kinda an idea is the same -- I am just recording options for the invocation of `crawl` (if I were to unify/meld `crawl-init` and `crawl`)...
